intro: Pseudochirita guangxiensis var. glauca, commonly known as the Guangxi glaucous pseudochirita, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves with a distinctive bluish-gray waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
